poem:
"Blue Lab in Eclipse"

The British jazz reborn, echoes greet,
Studio seclusions, in Blue Lab Beats meet.
NK-OK's beats spin life's deceit,
Though Mr DM's strings court replete.
A triad of souls in music's fleet,
Turned golden by Angélique's divine feat.
Through rhythm's veil, they seek discreet,
A jazzy tale on modern street.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Blue Lab Beats: Blue Eclipse review – jazzy production duo eye the spotlight The British jazz resurgence of the past decade has produced plenty of live talent, yet the production duo Blue Lab Beats have been just as prolific in the studio. Since their 2018 debut XOver, producer NK-OK (Namali Kwaten) and multi-instrumentalist Mr DM (David Mrakpor) have now released three more albums, as well as contributing to production on Angélique Kidjo’s Grammy-winning 2021 Mother". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Blue Lab Beats: Blue Eclipse review – jazzy production duo eye the spotlight The British jazz resurgence of the past decade has produced plenty of live talent, yet the production duo Blue Lab Beats have been just as prolific in the studio. Since their 2018 debut XOver, producer NK-OK (Namali Kwaten) and multi-instrumentalist Mr DM (David Mrakpor) have now released three more albums, as well as contributing to production on Angélique Kidjo’s Grammy-winning 2021 Mother
